DOCNAME: CASE OF MOLNAR GABOR v. SERBIA
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits (ratione temporis);Preliminary objection dismissed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);No violation of Art. 6-1;No violation of P1-1
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . Following the financial crisis in the former ORG , as well as the collapse of the banking system in GPE in DATE , in DATE and DATE the respondent ORG adopted specific legislation accepting the conversion of foreign currency deposits in certain banks , including Vojvođanska banka , into a public debt . The legislation set the time - frame ( DATE ) and the amounts , including interest , to be paid back to the banks ' former clients . It also explicitly provided , inter alia , that any foreign currency - related judicial proceedings were to be discontinued ( for details concerning the relevant domestic law see paragraphs DATE below ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He is retired and receives a pension in the net amount of MONEY ( “ NORP ” ) DATE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On a number of separate occasions , the applicant deposited a certain amount of his foreign currency savings with the LOC branch of GPE , a bank based in ORG .
CARDINAL . In DATE the said bank refused to release the applicant 's funds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a civil claim , seeking the release of his foreign currency deposits with the interest stipulated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE ruled partly in favour of the applicant and ordered the bank to pay him : ( i ) NORP PERSON ( “ DEM ” ) , on account of his foreign currency savings ; ( ii ) MONEY ( “ YUD ” ) , for his legal costs ; and ( iii ) the statutory interest due in respect of the latter as of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE upheld this judgment , adding that the respondent bank should also pay interest on the sum of ORG which had been awarded . In particular , this interest was to be paid as of DATE , based on the ORG sight deposit rate ( kamata na štedne uloge po viđenju ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the respondent 's appeal on points of law ( revizija ) and confirmed ORG judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , respectively , the applicant filed CARDINAL separate requests with ORG in GPE , seeking enforcement of the above judgment by means of a bank account transfer .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected those requests , stating that , under the relevant domestic legislation , all judicial enforcement proceedings aimed at the collection of foreign currency deposits had to be discontinued .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bank confirmed that the applicant 's foreign currency savings had been converted into a public debt in the amount of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . As of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was still owed ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , having in the meantime , in several instalments and on various grounds , been reimbursed a total of ORG .
CARDINAL . There is no information in the case file whether the applicant received any payments thereafter .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE and CARDINAL provided that all foreign currency savings deposited with “ authorised banks ” before DATE , including explicitly the deposits held by the bank at issue in the present case , were to become a public debt .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , the ORG 's responsibility in that respect was to be fully honoured by DATE through the payment of specified amounts , plus interest , and according to a certain time - frame .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provided that , as of the date of this LAW 's entry into force ( DATE ) , “ all pending lawsuits , including judicial enforcement proceedings , aimed at the collection of the foreign currency covered by this Act shall be discontinued . ”

CARDINAL . This Act repeals the LAW described above . In so doing , however , it explicitly acknowledges as part of the public debt all deposits previously recognised as such ( in the total amount of MONEY as of DATE ) . It modifies the time - frame for honouring the debt in question ( from DATE to DATE ) and specifies amended amounts , plus interest , to be paid DATE .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , the banks ' clients can make use of their deposits converted into Government bonds in order to pay taxes or indeed , under LAW and DATE , in advance of the said time - frame , for a number of purposes such as buying ORG property , taking part in the privatisation of ORG - owned businesses and banks , as well as , under certain conditions and up to a specified amount , the payment of medical treatment , medication and funeral costs .

CARDINAL . In accordance with ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL , former clients of the banks in question may sell the said bonds on the stock exchange or to other banks or individuals . Such trading is exempt from all taxation .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL reaffirms that “ all lawsuits aimed at the collection of the foreign currency savings covered by this LAW , including the judicial enforcement proceedings , shall be discontinued . ”

CARDINAL . This Act has been in force since DATE . It was subsequently amended on CARDINAL occasions , but these amendments concerned peripheral issues unrelated to the savers above - described status .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL provide , inter alia , that anyone who has suffered fear , physical pain or mental anguish as a consequence of a breach of “ personal rights ” ( prava ličnosti ) may , depending on its duration and intensity , sue for financial compensation before the civil courts and , in addition , request other forms of redress “ which may be capable ” of affording adequate non - pecuniary satisfaction .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that all claims recognised by a final court decision shall become time - barred within DATE , including those claims which would otherwise have become time - barred within a shorter period of time .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that courts shall not take into account whether a given claim is time - barred unless and until there is a specific objection by the debtor to this effect .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that statutory interest shall be paid as of the date of maturity of a recognised monetary claim in ORG until the date of its settlement ( which includes awards granted by final court judgments ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL states that such interest shall be calculated on the basis of the official retail price index ( mesečna stopa rasta cena na malo ) plus another PERCENT DATE ( mesečna fiksna stopa ) .
